alert.note: Alert for Pecos; Terrell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 9:12AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Pecos and north central Terrell Counties through 1000 AM CDT... At 911 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 22 miles north of Sanderson, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Pecos and north central Terrell Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
